meanings.definition: Envy or resent the possession or enjoyment of (someone)
meanings.sent1: She would begrudge her friend's success.
meanings.sent2: I sometimes begrudge others their good fortune.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but begrudge her luck in the game.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to begrudge the dog's attention.
meanings.sent5: The child's eyes begrudge the toy in his friend's hand.

meanings.sent1: I begrudge lending my bike to him.
meanings.sent2: She begrudged sharing her snacks with the class.
meanings.sent3: The old man would begrudge parting with his antique watch.
meanings.sent4: The tree might begrudge its leaves in the fall.
meanings.sent5: The teacher didn't begrudge giving extra help to the struggling student.
